thread.title: STEM Awards: frequently asked questions
thread.title_full: STEM Awards: frequently asked questions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: STEM Awards: frequently asked questions
text: Who is eligible to enter the STEM Awards? The competition is open to students currently studying at undergraduate level. A group of us are interested in entering. Can we do it as a team? Yes, you can enter the Awards as a team or as an individual. Does my idea need to be linked to my course? Your submission may tie in with a topic you’re currently studying and want to take to the next level, or you may have a totally original idea that you want to develop. Either way, have a chat to your tutors before you enter, and get their advice. What’s in it for me? The winning entry gets: • A £25,000 cash prize, presented by Babcock International Group • A bespoke mentoring programme courtesy of Babcock International Group Category winners get: • A placement or work-experience with the relevant category sponsor Key dates • 15 February, 2016: Closing date for all entries • 23 February, 2016: Each category sponsor will draw up a shortlist from the entries received, and invite those on it to present their idea in person • Early March, 2016: Shortlisted entries present to category sponsors at sponsor sites. Each sponsor will select one category winner • Mid March, 2016: Category winners selected • Late March, 2016: All category winners to present their idea at Babcock International Group’s UK headquarters • June, 2016: Final awards ceremony in London STEM Awards 2016 Change your future. Improve the world Are you a STEM student with dynamic ideas, ambition and the determination to make a difference in the world? If so, the STEM Awards 2016 is a unique opportunity to prove your talent to some of the biggest names in the industry – and put yourself in the running to win £25,000 . Visit the homepage for more information: www.telegraph.co.uk/stemawards
